titleStmt.title: Cogitations upon death, or, The mirror of mans misery being very choice and profitable lessons, for putting all Christians in a prepared condition for mortality.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in: National Library of Scotland.
At end: A dialogue bewixt Charon (i.e. Satan, the ferry-man of Hell) and contention, that dangerous, wicked, and horrid hellish sin. To the tune of, Through and though the rainy bow. P. 15-16.
